item.title: As more Instagram users engage with Stories, the app adds a comments feature
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Instagram’s latest feature aims to boost user interaction within Stories. The social media platform now allows followers to comment on each other’s Stories, making the experience more community-focused, akin to livestreaming where users can engage in larger discussions. A few users have already spotted the feature, including marketing strategist Taylor Loren (@taylor.loren on Threads). Meta […]

item.description:
Get ready for TechCrunch Disrupt 2024, our signature event for startups of all stages, happening at Moscone West in San Francisco from October 28-30. item.title: Spotter launches AI tools to help YouTubers brainstorm video ideas, thumbnails and more
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Spotter, the startup that provides financial solutions to content creators, announced Tuesday the launch of its new AI-powered creative suite. Dubbed Spotter Studio, the solution aims to support YouTubers throughout the creative process, such as helping them brainstorm video concepts, generate thumbnail and title ideas, plan projects, organize tasks and collaborate with their team. Most notably, […]

item.description:

The court will issue fines of up to $9,000 to those who use VPNs to […]

item.title: Xavier Niel replaces Coatue’s Laffont on board of TikTok parent ByteDance
item.dc:creator: Romain Dillet
item.description:
French billionaire Xavier Niel is joining the board of directors of TikTok’s parent, ByteDance, the company told the South China Morning Post. It’s an interesting move as Niel isn’t a name that comes up very often for high-profile board positions. He is replacing Philippe Laffont, the founder of the New York-based investment firm Coatue Management, […]

item.description:
X, the social network owned by Elon Musk, is finally rolling out one of the most sought-after features for direct messages: the ability to edit your message.
